title: Everton Director of Football Steve Walsh claims he's found the next N'Golo Kante in Idrissa Gueye
text:
Sport Everton Director of Football Steve Walsh claims he's found the next N'Golo Kante in Idrissa Gueye Gueye moved to Goodison Park from Aston Villa last summer and has emerged as a key player for the Toffees Share Everton Director of Football Steve Walsh, centre, uncovered N'Golo Kante, left, for Leicester and he rates Idrissa Gueye, right, equally highly (Photo: PA Wire/Everton FC via Getty Images)   
Everton Director of Football Steve Walsh believes he has found the next N'Golo Kante in Everton midfielder Idrissa Gueye. 
Walsh was responsible for Leicester's recruitment of Kante, 25, in the summer of 2015 and the Frenchman proved crucial as they defied 5,000/1 odds to win the Premier League last season. 
The Frenchman moved to Chelsea for £30million at the end of the Foxes' title-winning campaign and is having a similar impact at Stamford Bridge, with the Blues running away with the title thanks in part to Kante's performances in midfield. 
Walsh, meanwhile, left Leicester to return to the North West as Everton's Director of Football. N'Golo Kante has emerged as one of the Premier League's best players (Photo: AFP) Idrissa Gueye has had a big impact at Everton since joining the club from Aston Villa (Photo: Jan Kruger) 
The Toffees went on to sign Senegal international Gueye, 27, from Aston Villa and he has become a crucial player for Ronald Koeman's side this season. 
In an interview with The Times, Walsh was asked who could be the next Kante, to which he responded: “I’ve already found him!" 
Walsh added: “He was playing with a really poor back four [at Aston Villa] and being bypassed a lot when the ball went the other day. Steve Walsh became Everton's Director of Football last summer (Photo: Tony McArdle/Everton FC via Getty Images) 
"But I remember thinking, 'if I get the chance... this guy is better than he’s showing.' 
"He’s very grounded, gets whacked, gets up, gets around people when they have the ball, very much like Kante. 
"I’d say his use of the ball is slightly better, even if he’s not quite a good at retrieving." Like us on Facebook
